value.title: Biden transition official tells migrant caravans: 'Now is not the time' to come to US
value.excerpt: An unnamed Biden transition official told NBC News that migrants hoping to claim asylum in the U.S. during the first few weeks of the new administration "need to understand they're not going to be able to come into the United States immediately.

value.title: 'Health of the nation is literally at stake': Biden vows swift action on vaccine sites, supplies; 100 million shots
value.excerpt: BIden will add clinics, bolster the public health workforce and invoke a wartime production law to ensure adequate vaccine supplies.

value.title: Joe Biden's Options for Dealing with Donald Trump Are Worse than Watergate
value.excerpt: When it comes to Donald Trump, the incoming president has a critical decision to make about the best way to move the country forward—and neither Democrats nor Republicans are likely to be happy about his choice.

value.title: Politics updates: 'Horrified' Loews won't host Hawley fundraiser; Biden outlines orders planned for first 10 days
value.excerpt: "We are horrified and opposed to the events at the Capitol and all who supported and incited the actions," the hotel chain said in a statement.

value.title: Biden: We'll 'manage the hell' out of feds' COVID response
value.excerpt: President-elect Joe Biden is pledging to boost supplies of coronavirus vaccine and set up new vaccination sites to meet his goal of 100 million shots in 100 days

value.title: Federal prisons on lockdown in run-up to Biden inauguration
value.excerpt: Federal prisons across the U.S. have been placed on lockdown as officials aim to quell any potential violence that could arise in the run-up to President-elect Joe Biden’s inauguration on Wednesday

value.title: Biden: Science will be at `forefront' of his administration
value.excerpt: President-elect Joe Biden says “science will always be at the forefront of my administration,” and he's elevating the post of science adviser to Cabinet level, a White House first

value.title: Police: Man charged after displaying ‘KILL BIDEN’ sign
value.excerpt: A Virginia man has been arrested for having a “KILL BIDEN” sign. WWBT in Richmond reported Thursday that Kenneth Kraig Thomas of Goochland County was arrested and is facing a charge of threatening a person in writing.

value.title: Biden announces former FDA head David Kessler as chief science officer for vaccine drive to stop spread of coronavirus
value.excerpt: Biden announces former FDA head David Kessler as chief science officer for vaccine drive to stop spread of coronavirus

value.title: Joe Biden unveils $1.9tn US economic relief package
value.excerpt: President-elect Joe Biden has unveiled a $1.9tn (£1.4tn) stimulus plan for the coronavirus-sapped US economy before he takes office next week. If passed by Congress, it would include $1tn for households,

value.title: Asian shares mixed following Biden speech, Wall St retreat
value.excerpt: Asian shares were mixed on Friday after a late slide in several Big Tech stocks left major indexes lower on Wall Street. U.S. futures were trading slightly lower after President-elect Joe Biden announced his plans to propose a $1.

value.title: Fact Check: Was a Biden Campaign Official Arrested?
value.excerpt: A woman was arrested in Texas on multiple counts of voter fraud, causing social media users to make claims about who she was working for.

value.title: Reports: Joe Biden to pick Jaime Harrison as DNC chair
value.excerpt: Jaime Harrison, who challenged Lindsey Graham for his Senate seat during the past election, will be the new chair of the Democratic National Committee, according to media reports.

value.title: Biden picks Samantha Power, former UN envoy, for US aid post
value.excerpt: President-elect Joe Biden has selected Samantha Power, the U.S. ambassador to the United Nations under President Barack Obama, to run the U.S. Agency for International Development

value.title: Walmart, Disney suspend contributions to U.S. lawmakers who opposed Biden certification
value.excerpt: Walmart Inc, the world's biggest retailer and Walt Disney Co joined other major companies in indefinitely suspending donations to U.S. lawmakers who voted against President-elect Joe Biden's election certification.

value.title: Chicago Man Who Threatened to 'Kill' Democrats, Prevent Biden From Entering White House Arrested
value.excerpt: Louis Capriotti, a 45-year-old man from Chicago, made the alleged threats in a voicemail to a representative from New Jersey.

value.title: Biden chooses veteran diplomat William Burns as his CIA director
value.excerpt: William Burns, chosen by Biden to head the CIA, built a 33-year career at the State Department under both Republican and Democratic presidents.

value.title: AP interview: Libyan minister hopes for support from Biden
value.excerpt: The powerful interior minister of Libya’s U.N.-backed government, seen as a contender for the post of prime minister, says he hopes that bringing stability to his war-torn country will become a top pr

value.title: Biden says impeachment is a "decision for the Congress to make"
value.excerpt: "That's a decision for the Congress to make. I'm focused on my job," Mr. Biden said. He added that he will be speaking with House Speaker Nancy Pelosi and Democratic leaders later in the day. "I'll be speaking with Nancy and the Democratic leadership this afternoon,

value.title: NBA: Los Angeles Lakers hope to meet President Joe Biden but champions lose at Spurs
value.excerpt: The Los Angeles Lakers hope to re-establish the tradition of NBA champions visiting the president of the United States.

value.title: Biden Picks California Official Isabel Guzman to Head SBA
value.excerpt: President-elect Joe Biden announced Thursday that he picked California official Isabel Guzman to lead the Small Business Administration.

value.title: 'Double standard': Biden, Black lawmakers and activists decry police response to attack on US Capitol
value.excerpt: Civil rights leaders blasted police for their response to an attack on the U.S. Capitol compared to clashes between Black Lives protesters and police.

value.title: Biden picks Rhode Island Gov. Raimondo as commerce secretary
value.excerpt: President-elect Joe Biden has picked Rhode Island Gov. Gina Raimondo to lead the Commerce Department, helping set trade policy and looking to promote U.S. opportunities for growth domestically and ove

value.title: Joe Biden: Black Lives Matter protesters would have been ‘treated differently’ at Capitol demonstrations
value.excerpt: President-elect Joe Biden called protesters at the Capitol a “mob of thugs” and said if they were a group of Black Lives Matter demonstrators they would have been “treated very differently.”

value.title: Biden's pick for the Department of Homeland Security raked in millions at WilmerHale advising Blackstone, Airbnb, PNC and others
value.excerpt: Alejandro Mayorkas is leaving the partnership at Big Law firm WilmerHale to join the Biden administration.

value.title: Biden pick for Dept. of Justice's top civil rights post has called for partially defunding police
value.excerpt: President-elect Joe Biden is expected to pick Kristen Clarke, a civil rights lawyer, as Assistant Attorney General for the Civil Rights Division of the Department of Justice, which is expected to be a prioritized role in the Biden administration.

value.title: 'Morale has been gutted': can Biden restore the DoJ's battered reputation?
value.excerpt: Biden may well find his best intentions tested early on as the Trump administration has been busy planting legal landmines in his path

value.title: Biden calls on mob to ‘pull back,’ urges restoring decency
value.excerpt: President-elect Joe Biden is calling for the restoration of “simple decency” after a mob incited by his predecessor stormed the U.S. Capitol and delayed Congress from certifying Biden’s November elect

value.title: Biden has selected Judge Merrick Garland to serve as attorney general - Politico
value.excerpt: President-elect Joe Biden has selected Judge Merrick Garland to serve as his attorney general, Politico reported on Wednesday, citing two people with knowledge of the decision.

value.title: Joe Biden denounces violent mob at U.S. Capitol: "This must end now"
value.excerpt: "This is not dissent. It's disorder. It's chaos. It borders on sedition and it must end. Now," Mr. Biden said in remarks from Wilmington, Delaware. "I call on this mob to pull back and allow the work of democracy to go forward.
